content: Jump to the folder one level up

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a label that suggests jumping to the parent folder when pressed. It appears on a hotkeys panel and is used in conjunction with a backspace key action.

usage.context:
const NavigationBlock = ({ t, textStyles, keyTextStyles }) => {
 return (
 <>
 <Row className="hotkeys_row">
 <>
 <Text {...textStyles}>{t("HotkeysGoToParentFolder")}</Text>
 <Text {...keyTextStyles}>Backspace</Text>
 </>
 </Row>
 <Row className="hotkeys_row">
 <>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'القفز الى المجلد الاعلى' literally translates to 'Jump to the folder above'. While understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of 'Jump to the folder one level up' would be something like 'الانتقال إلى المجلد الأصل' or 'العودة إلى المجلد الأصل'. 'القفز' (jumping) doesn't accurately convey the action of navigating up a folder.
The translation 'Bir üst səviyyədəki qovluğa keçin' is a bit literal and verbose. A more natural phrasing would be closer to 'Parent folderə keç' or 'Ana qovluğa keç'

The translation "Прескочи към папката едно ниво нагоре" doesn't perfectly capture the meaning of "Jump to the folder one level up".  'Прескочи' (preskochi) implies skipping or jumping over, which might be misinterpreted. A more accurate translation would convey the action of navigating or going to the parent folder.

The translation "Saltar a la carpeta un nivel arriba" is a literal translation but not the most natural way to express 'Jump to the folder one level up' in Spanish. "Saltar" implies a jump, which isn't quite right in this context. A more appropriate verb would be 'Ir' or 'Subir'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ir a la carpeta un nivel arriba

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Passer au dossier un niveau plus haut' is a literal translation that doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'Jump to the folder one level up'. While technically correct, it sounds a bit clunky and less natural in French. A more idiomatic translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Monter d'un niveau dans le dossier

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Jump to the folder one level up' is more accurately translated as 'Go to the parent folder' or 'Open the parent folder'.  'Անցնել պանակը մեկ մակարդակ վեր' literally means 'Go to the folder one level up,' which, while understandable, isn't the most natural way to express 'go to the parent folder' in Armenian. It lacks the succinctness of the original.
The translation '한 레벨 위로 폴더 이동' is a literal translation but not the most natural way to express 'Jump to the folder one level up' in Korean. While understandable, it sounds slightly awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like '상위 폴더로 이동' or '부모 폴더로 이동'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ໂດດໄປຫາໂຟເດີຂຶ້ນລະດັບໜຶ່ງ' literally translates to 'Jump to the folder up one level'. While understandable, 'Jump' might not be the most accurate term in this context. A more suitable translation would convey the action of navigating *back* to the parent folder.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation that uses a word like 'ກັບໄປຫາ' (go back to) instead of 'ໂດດໄປຫາ' (jump to). A possible suggestion: 'ກັບໄປຫາໂຟເດີຂຶ້ນລະດັບໜຶ່ງ' (Go back to the folder one level up).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Saltar para a pasta um nível acima" is a literal translation of 'Jump to the folder one level up.'  A more natural Portuguese phrasing for a hotkey label would be something like 'Voltar para a pasta pai' or 'Ir para a pasta pai'. 'Saltar' (jump) isn't the typical verb used in this context.

The translation 'Pular para a pasta um nível acima' literally translates to 'Jump to the folder one level above.' While technically correct, 'Jump' isn't the most natural phrasing in this context. A more idiomatic translation would convey the action of navigating 'up' or 'back'.

The translation "Treci la folderul cu un nivel în sus" is not the most natural or precise translation of "Jump to the folder one level up." The word 'treci' (go) implies action from the user. A more accurate translation would be something like "Mergi la folderul părinte" or "Accesează folderul părinte".
The phrasing "cu un nivel în sus" is a bit verbose. It can be simplified.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use 'părinte' instead of 'cu un nivel în sus'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'බහාලුම් එක් මට්ටමක් ආපසු යන්න' while literally meaning 'Go back one level folder,' doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'Jump to the folder one level up.' It's a bit too literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more idiomatic translation like 'මුල් පිටුවට පිවිසිය' (Mula pituwa pivisiyata) which means 'Go back to the root folder' or a more general 'ඉහල් මට්ටම වෙත යන්න' (Ihal mattama veva yanna) which means 'Go to the higher level'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Скочи на фолдер један ниво горе" is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning effectively. "Скочи" (skochi) means 'jump' which is not the best choice for navigating folders. A more appropriate term would imply movement or navigation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Пређи на фолдер један ниво горе

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of the English word 'folder' (фолдер) is not ideal. While understood, it's preferable to use the Serbian equivalent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Пређи на папка један ниво горе

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Skoči na folder jedan nivo gore' doesn't perfectly convey the meaning of 'Jump to the folder one level up'. 'Skoči' (jump) implies a more abrupt action than is typically associated with navigating a folder hierarchy. A more natural phrasing would be 'Idi na folder jedan nivo gore' or 'Pređi na folder jedan nivo gore'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Idi na folder jedan nivo gore

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Jump to the folder one level up' implies a quick action. 'Atla' (jump) might be too literal and not accurately convey the intended action of navigating up a folder. A more accurate translation would emphasize navigation.

The translation 'Chuyển lên thư mục ngay bên trên' is a bit too literal and doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'Jump to the folder one level up' in a natural way for a hotkey label. It sounds a bit formal and verbose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more concise and user-friendly translation like 'Lên thư mục cha' or 'Thư mục cha'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '跳到上一层的文件夹' literally translates to 'Jump to the folder of the previous level'. While understandable, it's slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would emphasize moving 'up' a level.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 跳到上一级文件夹 (Tiào dào shàng yī jí fùjiàn)
